oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eleanor Roosevelt
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt visiting the Pickwick Landing Dam construction site in 1937.

Located in Hardin County, it is one of nine dams on the Tennessee River that is owned and operated by the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA). The dam was built as part of a New Deal initiative to connect the mouth of the Tennessee River to Knoxville and bring economic development and hydroelectric power to the area. During the course of construction from 1935 to 1938, the TVA relocated 506 families, 407 graves, and 70 miles of roads.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Presidents' spouses; Dams; Visiting
